content: On a two-lane street your vehicle is being followed by a fire engine that is not using emergency signals.
option1: Continue to drive in a normal manner.
option2: Stop as quickly as you can.
option3: Speed up to get out of the way.
option4: Slow down; move as far to the right as possible and stop.

content: What should you do when you approach an intersection controlled by four-way stop signs?
option2: Slow down, stopping only if necessary.
option3: Stop, wait your turn, and go when safe.
option4: Speed up and clear the intersection.

content: You are driving at a constant speed of 90 kilometers per hour. How long will it take you to travel 180 kilometers?
If your car's stopping distance is 25 meters at 50 km/h, what will be the stopping distance at 100 km/h, assuming stopping distance increases with the square of the speed?
Your car uses 7 liters of fuel per 100 kilometers. How much fuel will you need to drive 350 kilometers
You need to cover 150 kilometers in 2 hours. What should be your average speed to reach your destination on time?
If your reaction time is 1.2 seconds and you are driving at 90 km/h, how many meters will your car travel before you begin to apply the brakes? (1 km/h = 0.27778 m/s)
You need to arrive at a destination 150 kilometers away in 2.5 hours. What should be your average speed in kilometers per hour to arrive on time?
